errors.error_description: The `git commit` command in the 'Contributing' section is syntactically incorrect because it is missing the `-m` flag to specify the commit message.
correction_candidates: Commit your changes (```git commit -am 'Added some feature'```)
Commit your changes (```git commit -m 'Added some feature'```)
Commit your changes (```git commit --message 'Added some feature'```)
Commit your changes (```git commit -a -m 'Added some feature'```)
errors.golden_answer: Commit your changes (```git commit -am 'Added some feature'```)

errors.error_description: The path to the test directory is specified as `tests/`, but the correct path is `rollbar/test`.
correction_candidates: Tests are in `rollbar/test`.
Tests are in `rollbar/test/`.
Tests are in the `rollbar/test` directory.
Tests are in `rollbar/test`. To run the tests: `python setup.py test`
errors.golden_answer: Tests are in `rollbar/test`. To run the tests: `python setup.py test`

errors.error_description: The Python version compatibility for PyRollbar v1.0.0 is vaguely listed as '3.x', which does not specify the exact supported minor versions and could lead to compatibility issues.
correction_candidates: Python 3.6+
All versions of Python 3
3.6 and newer

errors.error_description: The setup instructions unnecessarily direct the user to manually install the `requests` library, which is already a dependency of `pyrollbar` and would be installed automatically.
correction_candidates: Follow the [Quick Start](https://docs.rollbar.com/docs/python#section-quick-start) instructions in our [Python SDK docs](https://docs.rollbar.com/docs/python) to install pyrollbar and configure it for your platform.

Ensure you have `pip` installed, then follow the [Quick Start](https://docs.rollbar.com/docs/python#section-quick-start) instructions in our [Python SDK docs](https://docs.rollbar.com/docs/python) to install pyrollbar and configure it for your platform.
First, install `pyrollbar` by running `pip install rollbar`, then follow the instructions in our [Python SDK docs](https://docs.rollbar.com/docs/python).
Remove the unnecessary `pip install requests` step from the setup instructions.
errors.golden_answer: Follow the [Quick Start](https://docs.rollbar.com/docs/python#section-quick-start) instructions in our [Python SDK docs](https://docs.rollbar.com/docs/python) to install pyrollbar and configure it for your platform.

errors.error_description: The contribution workflow incorrectly lists pushing to a branch before committing changes. A commit must be made locally before it can be pushed to a remote repository.
correction_candidates:
3. Commit your changes (```git commit -am 'Added some feature'```)
4. Push to the branch (```git push origin my-new-feature```)

3. Stage your changes (```git add .```) and commit them (```git commit -m 'Added some feature'```)
4. Push to the branch (```git push origin my-new-feature```)

3. Commit your changes to a new branch (```git commit -am 'Added some feature'```)
4. Push the new branch to origin (```git push origin my-new-feature```)

3. Commit your changes using `git commit -am 'Added some feature'`
4. Push to the branch using `git push origin my-new-feature`
errors.golden_answer:
3. Commit your changes (```git commit -am 'Added some feature'```)
4. Push to the branch (```git push origin my-new-feature```)

errors.error_description: The command to run tests is specified as `pytest`, but the project is configured to run tests via `python setup.py test`. Using `pytest` directly may fail if not properly configured.
correction_candidates: To run the tests: `python setup.py test`
To run the tests: `python -m unittest discover`
To run the tests: `tox`
To run the tests: `py.test rollbar/test`
errors.golden_answer: To run the tests: `python setup.py test`
